main.name: Anthony Xiang
main.contactmessage: Let's keep in touch! Comments, questions, and concerns can be sent here:

education.degree: Bachelor of Science, Double major in Statistics & Computer Science, minor in Mathematics
education.description: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant, Chinese Association of Stony Brook, Club Volleyball, Stony Brook Computing Society, Organization of Actuarial Students, SBUHacks Organizing Committee, Student Accessibility Support Center
education.courses: Linear Algebra, Probability and Graph Theory, Object-Oriented Programming, Web Genomics Project Team, Probability and Statistics (F’ 19), Data Structures and Algorithms (F’ 19), Operations Research (F’ 19)
education.desc2: Stony Brook Honors College (top 5% of incoming class), Presidential Scholarship, New York State Academic Excellence Scholarship, Dean's List (F' 18, S'19)

education.description: Varsity Volleyball Co-Captain, International Club President, Varsity Fencing Squad Lead, Quizbowl Team Treasurer, Math Team, Varsity Bowling
education.courses: AP - Statistics, Computer Science, Physics E&M, Physics Mechanics, BC Calculus, US History, Spanish Language, World History, Psychology, Microeconomics, Macroeconomics
education.desc2: Nassau Math Tournament 5th Place, USA Mathematical Talent Search Bronze 2016 and 2017, Princeton University Mathematics Competition Individual Finalist, National History Bowl 15th Place

work.company: Stony Brook Biomedical Informatics - Data Management and Biomedical Data Analytics Lab
work.title: Research Assistant
work.d1: Investigated associations between opioid use and presidential voting patterns in a 10-week summer research program (REU) in Big Spatial and Image Data Analytics under Dr. Fusheng Wang, continuing through the school year.
work.d2: Mapped election, opioid use, and demographic data using ArcGIS and built regression models in Python with SciPy.
work.d3: Reduced cleaning of over 4 million data entries by a week using pandas to format and merge presidential voting data.
work.d4: Communicated results with a culminating research poster and oral presentation to professors, statisticians, doctors, and addiction psychiatrists.

work.title: Computer Programming Teacher
work.d1: Leading two weekly programming classes in beginner Python and Scratch/Arduino for 15 students ages 6-15.
work.d2: Improving student learning and retention by designing and implementing interactive course content and exercises.

work.title: Mentor
work.d1: Stimulating classroom engagement by assisting students ages 7-17 one-on-one during classes in Java, Python, and Scratch.
work.d2: Grading and providing constructive feedback on over 1,500 online coding challenge submissions through the OYOclass platform for over 80 schools across Long Island.

work.title: Tour Guide
work.d1: Led night bus tours of Manhattan and communicated historical information in both English and Mandarin Chinese to over 50 passengers.
work.d2: Received and efficiently transported guests from LGA and JFK airports to their hotels.
work.d3: Assisted guests in obtaining key cards to hotel rooms.

work.title: Intern
work.d1: Composed real estate articles to share on the main blog of the real estate crowdfunding platform, Sharestates.
work.d2: Created posters and graphic designs to be put on social media sites such as Instagram and Facebook.
work.d3: Researched advertising rates, real estate news, and local neighborhood statistics.

activities.title: Event Coordinator
activities.description: Leading logistical planning for food/snacks, workshops, and activities for a 24-hour student-run hackathon at Stony Brook. Creating layout and itinerary for the event. Communicating with clubs, supervisors, sponsors, and professors to sort out scheduling conflicts.

activities.title: Mentor
activities.description: Assisting students with disabilities with their transition to college life.

activities.title: Event Coordinator Assistant
activities.description: Worked with Event Coordinators to design layout and itinerary of events catering to 300+ attendees. Promoted Chinese culture through various exciting events and increasing the Chinese presence on campus and beyond.

activities.title: Active Member
activities.description: Participating in various volleyball tournaments at Yale, Columbia, and Hofstra against other collegiate club volleyball teams.

activities.title: Member
activities.description: Attended career workshops, career fairs, and seminars on compuational best practices.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
